```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(flexdashboard)
library(tidyverse)
library(viridis)
library(shiny)
library(plotly)
library(ggplot2)
## Loading required package: viridisLite



```


```{r data, include=FALSE}

load(file = "merged_nhanes.RData")


nhanes_shiny = 
  nhanes %>% 
  mutate(
      hepbvax = factor(hepbvax, levels = c('No Doses', 'Less Than Three Doses', 'At Least Three Doses')
      ))

#saving this as an object in order to provide separation between nhanes data and any further data manipulation

```

### Hep B Vaccination Status

```{r, echo = FALSE}

renderPlotly({
  nhanes_shiny %>% 
  filter(
         gender == input[["sex_bin"]],
         race == input[["race_cat"]],
         educat == input[["edu_cat"]]) %>% 
  count(hepbvax) %>% 
  plot_ly(x = ~hepbvax, y = ~n, color = ~hepbvax, type = "bar") %>% 
    layout(title = 'Hep B Vaccination Status', plot_bgcolor = "#e5ecf6", xaxis = list(title = '# of Hep B Vax Doses'), 
         yaxis = list(title = '# of Respondents'), legend = list(title=list(text ='<b> Doses </b>')))
})

  
```


### Comparing Vaccination to Age (years) by Insurance

```{r, echo = FALSE}
renderPlot({
  nhanes_shiny %>% 
  filter(
         gender == input[["sex_bin"]],
         race == input[["race_cat"]],
         educat == input[["edu_cat"]]
         ) %>% 
  ggplot(aes( x = hepbvax, y = agecrude, color = insany)) + geom_violin()
})
```


### Comparing History of Hep B and Hep C by Insurance

```{r, echo = FALSE}

renderPlot({
  nhanes_shiny %>% 
  filter(
         gender == input[["sex_bin"]],
         race == input[["race_cat"]],
         educat == input[["edu_cat"]],
         ) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(hepb, y = hepc, fill = insany)) + geom_col(position = "fill")
})
```
